sentence.text: Here, we show that selective overexpression of the stress protein, heme oxygenase-1 (HO-1) in astrocytes of GFAP.HMOX1 transgenic epidermis development between 8.5 and 19 months of age results in nigrostriatal hypodopaminergia associated with locomotor incoordination and stereotypy; downregulation of tyrosine hydroxylase, monoamine transport, regulation of transcription, DNA-templated, transcription, DNA-templated, lens development in camera-type eye and DJ-1 mRNA and/or protein; overproduction of α-synuclein and ubiquitin; oxidative stress; basal ganglia siderosis; mitochondrial damage/mitophagy; and augmented GABAergic systems (increased GABA, GAD67 and reelin).

The neurophenotype of these GFAP.HMOX1<sup>8.5-19m</sup> epidermis development is highly consistent with parkinsonism and differs dramatically from the schizophrenia-like features previously documented in younger GFAP.HMOX1<sup>0-12m</sup> mice.
